geneVariantDescriptions.description: LRP1B W1344* results in a premature truncation of the Lrp1b protein at amino acid 1344 of 4599 (UniProt.org). Due to the loss of the transmembrane and cytoplasmic domains and a majority of the extracellular domain (UniProt.org), W1344* is predicted to lead to a loss of Lrp1b protein function.

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a clinical case study, a patient with melanoma harboring BRAF V600E developed progressive disease after 12 weeks of Tafinlar (dabrafenib) and Mekinist (trametinib) combination treatment, and progressed again after 106 weeks on anti-PD1 therapy including Opdivo (nivolumab) (90 weeks) followed by Keytruda (pembrolizumab), B2M V5Lfs*30, LRP1B W1344*, MAP2K2 F133L, NF2 Y66*, and TP53 C238F were identified in the post-progression biopsy in addition to BRAF V600E (PMID: 31082388).

molecularProfile.profileName: B2M V5Lfs*30 BRAF V600E LRP1B W1344* MAP2K2 F133L NF2 Y66* TP53 C238F

references.title: Sequential treatment failures in response to BRAF/MEK and immune checkpoint inhibitors mediated by MAP2K2 and B2M mutations in melanoma.
